Hello !!

I've been spending some time lately trying to familiarise myself with 
MockObjects.  I've learned quite a bit but I'm having trouble 
creating MockObjects from Classes that use Static Methods.

e.g. 

public class TaskGroup implements ITaskGroup {
  
  public static void execute() {
    // Implementation of method
  }

  // ...
  // 
  // Remaining TaskGroup code ...
  // 
  // ... 

}


In this case a MockObject must extend TaskGroup instead of 
implementing ITaskGroup.  

Is this the only way to go about creating MockObjects from such 
classes?  Is there a refactoring pattern I could employ that would 
allow me to Mock the Interface instead of the Concreate Class?

I have considered placing all static methods in an abstract TaskGroup 
and causing each method to immediately throw a 
java.lang.UnsupportedOperation Exception.  This allows me to create a 
MockObject from the abstract class (i.e. The mockobject does not 
extend the domain code) but this approach strikes me as very 
questionable design.

I'd appreciate any suggestions, web links or general abuse.

Rob.
